summary: This bill, the Advancing Frequent and Tailored Education to Rebuild Safe Communities and Help Orchestrate Opportunities and Learning Act (AFTER SCHOOL Act), proposes grants to local educational agencies and nonprofit organizations to operate after-school programs for students in grades 6-12 in areas with high juvenile crime rates. The Attorney General will award grants based on a formula considering the number of eligible students served. Programs must include educational activities and provide a safe environment. The bill authorizes appropriations of $15 million per year for fiscal years 2026-2029.
